Package com.accele.gage.gfx

Enum TextureWrapParameter

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<TextureWrapParameter>
      • com.accele.gage.gfx.TextureWrapParameter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NativeValueHoldable, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<TextureWrapParameter>
    public enum TextureWrapParameter
extends java.lang.Enum<TextureWrapParameter>
implements NativeValueHoldable
    Represent values used for texture wrap parameters.

    These values are designed for use with the setTextureWrapSParameter(TextureWrapParameter) and setTextureWrapTParameter(TextureWrapParameter) methods.

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant Description
      CLAMP_TO_BORDER
      Causes the texture to clamp its image to its original size.
      CLAMP_TO_EDGE
      Causes the texture to clamp its image to its original size.
      MIRRORED_REPEAT
      Causes the texture to repeat mirrored at the edge on areas larger than the actual texture size.
      REPEAT
      Causes the texture to repeat on areas larger than the actual texture size.

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • REPEAT

        public static final TextureWrapParameter REPEAT
        Causes the texture to repeat on areas larger than the actual texture size.

      • MIRRORED_REPEAT

        public static final TextureWrapParameter MIRRORED_REPEAT
        Causes the texture to repeat mirrored at the edge on areas larger than the actual texture size.

      • CLAMP_TO_EDGE

        public static final TextureWrapParameter CLAMP_TO_EDGE
        Causes the texture to clamp its image to its original size.

        If the target area is larger than the texture, the texture will extend its border pixels to the edge of the area.

      • CLAMP_TO_BORDER

        public static final TextureWrapParameter CLAMP_TO_BORDER
        Causes the texture to clamp its image to its original size.

        If the target area is larger than the texture, the pixels outside of the range will be given a specified border color (usually black by default).
